div.p: Muy bien se muestra en tu virtud la nobleza de tu sangre. Leida la carta hize tocar trompetas y añafiles en regozijo de tu convite y se convino entre todas las donzellas de mi linage, que gozosas iremos con tigo al sarao dispuesto por el noble Caballero que da las Fiestas y Zambras
Ala te embio bonanza y queda con el.
div.closer: No mas De la Alhambra Daraxa Pariente del Rey Chico de Granada
div.note: Brave Gentleman hidalgo The nobility of your blood shows very well in your virtue. Having read the letter, I made the trumpets and añafiles long, straight Moorish trumpets sound in rejoicing at your invitation and it was agreed among all the maidens donzelas of my lineage linaje, that we will joyfully go with you to the sarao musical soirée arranged by the noble Knight who gives the Feasts and Zambras dances associated with Spanish gypsies and supposedly of Moorish origin. Allah send you te envíe prosperity and be with him. No more From the Alhambra Daraxa Kinswoman of the Rey Chico the Boy King, Muhammad XII of Granada

This letter may be of WG's composition: the first line ('Muy bien ... tu sangre') opens a different letter in Ginés Pérez de Hita, Historia de los Vandos de los Cegries y Abencerrages... (Barcelona, 1757), p. 44 (and presumably in many other editions), while Daraxa herself and many of the things mentioned here (trumpets, añafiles, zambra, sarao etc) appear elsewhere in the book. The Mirador de Daraxa is a part of the Alhambra complex.
